intro: Leptospermum scoparium var. linifolium, commonly known as the silver myrtle, is a variant of the manuka plant native to New Zealand. It is characterized by its narrow, silver-gray leaves that are covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in spring, followed by orange-red berries. It thrives in coastal and subalpine regions, often growing in well-drained soils. This variety is valued for its ornamental qualities and has some traditional uses by Māori for medicinal purposes.
